content:
After discussion with @Mario Carneiro about expanding docs for Â Init.Data.List.BasicAux to the same level as Init.Data.List.Basic (link), I would like to create a GitHub issue to track.

I am assuming this should be an RFC issue so I am posting on Zulip first so I can include any feedback:

Using docs in Init.Data.List.Basic as an exemplar, in Init.Data.List.BasicAux,

  • add docs and example usage to get!, get?, getD, head!, headD,head,tail!, tail?, tailD, getLast, getLast!, getLast?, getLastD, rotateLeft, rotateRight, mapMono
  • add example usage to existing docs for mapMonoM, partitionM

I don't think adding docs needs to be an RFC (at least, if it is then I feel like RFCs are not being used for the right thing). It should be safe to skip to the PR stage, just take it slow at the beginning until it is clear that the style matches what the team is looking for

Got it. As I was writing this out I wondered if it would be overkill for adding docs, but I didn't want to jump ahead without confirmation.

I will start with the first five functions and make a draft PR to get feedback and make sure the style matches expectations before moving forward.

Thanks!
Austin Letson has marked this topic as resolved.
Great that you want to contribute documentation! There is an open PR at https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/3864, so don't duplicate that work :-)
Thank you for flagging that PR! I will be sure not to duplicate (and also do a more thorough search of existing PRs in the future :man_facepalming:)
